artist: Painter: Francis Hayman; Engraver: Charles Grignion
description: four figures a a cave; woman carrying Greek scroll; man in Roman dress; man holding a book wearing ragged clothing; young man seated at a table with paper and quill; illustration for Pope's "Essay on Criticisim"
inscription:
Signature, and Inscription

in plate in black: [Plate XXIV   Vol VI facing p.1/ F. Haymann inv et del   C. Grignion sculp./Hail Bards triumphant! born in happier Days;/ Immortal Heirs of universal Praise!/ Oh may some Spark of your celestial Fire/ the last, the meanest of your sons inspire./ Essay on Crit.]; on sheet below image in pencil: [1-525]
title: Print
